title: Origin turns to Amazon amid tough competition
text:
Stronger competition from new energy retailers has forced traditional retailers like Origin Energy to fight to retain customers.

They are doing this by abandoning quarterly meter readings in favour of active energy management through live data collection, which is now possible through advances in cloud technology.

Adam Beavis, commercial director at Amazon Web Services in Australia and New Zealand, said cloud computing, which allows large amounts of data to be stored and quickly processed on servers held in warehouses, has facilitated this transition to a customer-centric energy market.

Amazon Web Services executive Adam Beavis says data is driving big changes in the energy market. Louie Douvis

Mr Beavis, who addressed The Australian Financial Review National Energy Summit on Wednesday, said in an interview ahead of the event that AWS client Origin Energy now collects smart meter data every half an hour, generating over 17,520 data points, up from just four per year from quarterly readings.

This data generated in retail customer homes and commercial businesses is processed and stored by AWS on its servers in Sydney, rather than Origin building its own infrastructure.
description: Origin Energy is fighting to combat low customer trust and high turnover by putting their data, collected by Amazon Web Services, in the hands of customers.
